    • Method Detail

      • trackUncaughtExceptions

        public static Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler trackUncaughtExceptions(Tracker tracker)
        This will create an exception handler that wraps any existing exception handler. Exceptions will be caught, tracked, dispatched and then rethrown to the previous exception handler.

        Be wary of relying on this for complete crash tracking.. Think about how to deal with older app versions still throwing already fixed exceptions.

        See discussion here: https://github.com/piwik/piwik-sdk-android/issues/28

        Parameters:
        tracker - the tracker that should receive the exception events.
        Returns:
        returns the new (but already active) exception handler.

      • bindToApp

        public static android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks bindToApp(android.app.Application app,
                                                           Tracker tracker)
        This method will bind a tracker to your application, causing it to automatically track Activities within your app.
        Parameters:
        app - your app
        tracker - the tracker to use
        Returns:
        the registered callback, you need this if you wanted to unregister the callback again

      • track

        public static void track(PiwikApplication piwikApplication,
         android.app.Activity activity)
        Calls Tracker.trackScreenView(String, String) for an activity. Uses the activity-stack as path and activity title as names.
        Parameters:
        piwikApplication -
        activity -
